name: BBCWorld
text:
A suspected case of bubonic plague has been reported to authorities in China

It‚Äôs not known how the patient got infected, but the country is on alert

The plague is one of the deadliest diseases in history, but can be treated with antibiotics

[Thread]

https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi https://t.co/Hx71JDt3gr

name: BBCWorld
text:
Bubonic plague is a potentially lethal infectious disease that is caused by bacteria that live in some animals and their fleas üêÄ 

Millions died from it in the Middle Ages

From 2010 to 2015 there were 3,248 cases worldwide, including 584 deaths

https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi https://t.co/iV9A6pTMz3

name: BBCWorld
text:
People can catch it from:

-Bites from infected fleas
-Touching infected animals such as rats and mice üêÄ
-Inhaling droplets spread by infected people or animals üêï

Cats and dogs can become infected from flea bites or after eating infected rodents

https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi https://t.co/AuwALtGGiY

name: BBCWorld
text:
Bubonic plague is treatable but prompt intervention with antibiotics is vital as the disease is often lethal if left untreated

Early diagnosis, using laboratory tests on blood and other body samples, can save lives

https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi https://t.co/tDG1aytP1J

name: BBCWorld
text:
In recent years there have been outbreaks in the Democratic Republic of Congo and Madagascar

"Bubonic plague is caused by a bacterium,‚Äù says University of Southampton's Dr Matthew Dryden: ‚ÄúUnlike Covid-19, [it's] readily treated with antibiotics"

https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi https://t.co/oDHwy5dRQ3

name: BBCWorld
text:
Discover more about the bubonic plague and scientists working to control the disease:
https://t.co/QULQ5QuzHi

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Chinese city of Wuhan, where coronavirus first emerged, is still feeling the effects of the coronavirus outbreak

Called Sars-CoV-2, the virus which causes Covid-19 is still providing more questions than answers in the central-Chinese city

[Thread]

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/8IzW9bTHxa

name: BBCWorld
text:
More than 11 million people around the world are known to have been infected with Sars-CoV-2, and more than 500,000 have died with it

But where did this disease come from?

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/e181YVvMa6

name: BBCWorld
text:
On 1 December 2019, a man in his 70s fell ill in Wuhan - he was later diagnosed as the first patient with Covid-19

But it wasn‚Äôt until 23 January 2020 that Wuhan went into lockdown

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/xuMZYHNtNn

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Huanan Seafood Market was originally believed to be where the virus emerged

A large number of coronaviruses are carried by bats

Sometimes they jump directly from bats to humans, or they jump from bats to an intermediary animal, and then on to humans

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/kPS41B3Wwn

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Sars coronavirus, which caused 774 deaths, is thought to have jumped from bats to humans via the civet cat

Nearly two decades on, there was initial speculation that the new coronavirus, Sars-CoV-2, came from an intermediary host animal at the market

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/bS4K3IkWhP

name: BBCWorld
text:
This theory has been dismissed by China

According to their tests, traces of the virus were found there, but none were detected on any animal samples

They say the outbreak likely began elsewhere, and the crowded market helped to spread it

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/Pix3vGlsbl

name: BBCWorld
text:
However, scientists agree that somewhere - market or otherwise - Sars-CoV-2 jumped from animal to human 

There has been an increasing number of ‚Äúspillover‚Äù events, driven by factors including population growth and encroachment on natural habitats

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/hYHYmuXCLp

name: BBCWorld
text:
It‚Äôs important to know where Sars-CoV-2 emerged from, in order to understand the possibility of future infections from the same animal source

The World Health Organization called for an international effort to trace the intermediate animal host in May

https://t.co/iTzVUlFpo5 https://t.co/ujTxwxazsp

name: BBCWorld
text:
Another theory, that the virus came from the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV), has also gained some traction 

But none of the lab leak theories ‚Äì animal virus, man-made virus, deliberate or accidental ‚Äì have been backed up with any concrete proof

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/g5UegynUeO

name: BBCWorld
text:
The lab leak theory became more well known after US President Donald Trump said he had seen evidence that the WIV was the origin of the virus

But the theory has been largely dismissed by scientists

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/gpFUJNP0N7

name: BBCWorld
text:
Many scientists are now trying to understand how to better contain a similar outbreak 

There‚Äôs disagreement as to whether the risks of studying and manipulating viruses in labs outweigh the benefits

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/kMrxoKd1uw

name: BBCWorld
text:
China has agreed to an independent investigation into the international response to the virus, but it‚Äôs unclear what the remit will be, who will take part, and when it might happen 

President Xi says it will have to wait until the pandemic is over

https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF https://t.co/oNTBB6jryD

text: Read more about the origins of the virus, and it‚Äôs fallout in Wuhan, here: https://t.co/iTzVUlX0MF
